gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm
Class ProductFactory

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm.ProductFactory

public final class ProductFactory
extends java.lang.Object

ProductFactory creates a Product object from a database Product record. It is not public. It exists to reduce the size of the DSM class. It should not be instantiated.

This could be a Product constructor, but I want to keep Product small. Creating a product object requires subsequent database queries, which is much more than I want Product to know about.

Version:
3.0.0 Added the product creation date field and site awareness., 3.19 Added "published" to Resource creation.

removeProduct

public static void removeProduct(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                 java.lang.String productID,
                                 FileMover fm)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Removes a Product (and all products that depend on it) from the database. If you want associated files removed from IS, pass in a FileMover object whose "to" side is IS. Does NOT observe the deleteProtected flag. It it safe to reprocess data recreating a Product after it has been removeProduct()ed.

java.lang.Exception

removeProducts

public static void removeProducts(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                  java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> products,
                                  FileMover fm)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Removes a list of Products (and all products that depend on them) from the database. Removes records of Resources - NOT THE RESOURCE FILES. Does NOT observe the deleteProtected flag. It it safe to reprocess data recreating a Product after it has been removeProduct()ed.

Removes one Product from the database. Removes all records of all resources associated with this product. Note that this does NOT commit().

checkProductResources

public static void checkProductResources(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                         java.lang.String productID)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Checks a Product - if it has no resources, deletes all knowledge of it from the database. NOTE that this takes a database statement, and does NOT commit() anything it does.

java.lang.Exception

rootProducts

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> rootProducts(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                           java.lang.String passID)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Given a Pass ID, returns a Set of the root Product IDs in this pass (Products with no ancestors). This is the set of Products that must be retained to reprocess a Pass.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Takes a Product ID and a Set of other Product IDs. Adds immediate children of the Product to the Set; returns a List of anything newly added to the Set.

                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> children)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Takes a List of Product IDs and a Set of other Product IDs. Adds all children of all Products in the List to the Set (recursing down to get all the distant relatives).
